Labophase Death Game

106

Chapter:

1075

Japanese Title:

研究層（ラボフェーズ） DEATH GAME（デスゲーム）

Romanized Title:

Rabofēzu Desu Gēmu

Viz Title:

Labophase Death Game

Pages:

15

Release Date:

February 20, 2023

WSJ Issue:

2023 Issue 12

Anime:

Episode 1107 (p. 2-10)
Episode 1108 (p. 10-15)
Chapter Chronology
← Previous Next →
Chapter 1075 is titled "Labophase Death Game".

Contents

  • 1 Cover Page
  • 2 Short Summary
  • 3 Long Summary
  • 4 Quick References
    • 4.1 Chapter Notes
    • 4.2 Characters
  • 5 Author Comment
  • 6 Arc Navigation

Cover Page[]

Germa 66's Ahh... An Emotionless Excursion, Vol. 31: "The Genius Scientist gets an audience with the Five Elders"

Vegapunk meets the Five Elders.

Short Summary[]

As the groups are still looking for Vegapunk, Shaka notices someone is taking out the surveillance so they could not find Vegapunk easily. Usopp's group finds a badly damaged Pythagoras who had to disconnect its head from the body who while surprised warns the group as S-Snake appears and petrifies York and then attacks them. As Luffy's group is attacked by S-Bear and S-Hawk, Shaka realizes someone had gained control of the Seraphim and is trying to kill them all. Realizing they are also in danger a reawakened Lucci and Kaku suggest a temporary alliance, much to the chagrin of Luffy and Zoro.

Long Summary[]

Shaka tries to reach Pythagoras following the explosion he heard, but he receives no response. He sends a Cameko to search the tower, but someone takes it out, cutting off the security image. Luffy realizes that the communication device he is wearing does not operate any longer, as if all communications have been cut off. Luffy tells Shaka as he tries to contact the other Satellites, but one-by-one, all of the Cameko go off, making him think that someone else is in the Labophase causing trouble.

Throughout the Labophase, everyone is searching for Dr. Vegapunk. In Tower A Floor 3, Nami and Brook are traveling with Edison. Nami gets sidetracked by diamonds she finds and wants to keep despite Edison telling her that their priority is finding the Stella. When he tells her that they were manmade, Nami is left in awe over such achievements. On Floor 2, Chopper and Robin are with Atlas, who reveals that her face is a mask and she can replace whatever part of her gets damaged. Robin then notices something which Atlas reveals is an artificial organ, which amazes Chopper, though Robin notes she thought Vegapunk had gotten chopped up, much to Atlas’ discomfort.

In the B Tower, Sanji and Jinbe have gone with Stussy, with Sanji swooning over her and asking if she would call him a dog, while she flirtatiously reminds him to find Vegapunk. Jinbe acknowledges how huge the part of the lab they are in is as Stussy reveals that they are on the weapon’s manufacturing floor, so they can’t be setting off any shockwaves. As for the last group, which consists of Usopp, Franky, Lilith, and York, the four head to Tower C. They end up finding Pythagoras’ body, albeit with his head missing. Thankfully, Pythagoras turned out to be fine, as he had detached his head from his body before he sustained damage. He starts freaking out over what happened just as York walks over to S-Snake. She tells her to wait outside since Edison ordered her to stand down, but instead, S-Snake petrifies York. A confused Lilith tries to get her to stop, but S-Snake ignores and fires a laser at the four. It destroys the bridge they were on and they all fall, though they land safely. Lilith tries to reach Shaka but fails to do so, and when Franky suggests they fight back, Lilith tells him it is impossible to beat a Seraphim.

Back in Tower A, Luffy and Shaka meet up with Zoro as they see that S-Bear and S-Hawk have breached the room. Despite Shaka’s attempts to make them stop, the two Seraphim open fire. Thankfully, they evade their attacks while also saving the unconscious Lucci and Kaku, who were in the Seraphim’s sights. Shaka begins to fear that Vegapunk himself is commanding the Seraphim if the Satellites cannot get them to stop. He also realizes that someone is trying to kill everyone by trapping them and cutting off communications, and that they set up this situation very carefully. Lucci and Kaku then wake up and ask Luffy and Zoro to set the two of them free, offering that they form a truce and work together to survive. Luffy and Zoro respond with a look of disgust.

Quick References[]

Chapter Notes[]

  • Shaka notices an unknown figure destroying the cameras of the laboratory's surveillance system.
  • The Straw Hats have split into groups to search for Vegapunk.
    • Luffy and Zoro remain with Shaka.
    • Nami and Brook are paired with Edison.
    • Chopper and Robin are paired with Atlas.
    • Sanji and Jinbe are paired with Stussy.
    • Usopp and Franky are paired with Lilith and York.
  • Usopp's group find Pythagoras, who survived the explosion.
  • The Seraphim have begun attacking the Satellites and Straw Hats.
    • York is turned to stone by S-Snake, who then attacks Usopp's group.
    • S-Bear and S-Hawk are attacking Luffy's group.
    • Shaka speculates that "Vegapunk" has given the Seraphim orders to kill everyone present.
  • Lucci and Kaku have woken up.
    • Realizing that the Seraphim are ordered to kill them as well, Lucci and Kaku propose a temporary alliance with Luffy and Zoro.

Author Comment[]


Author Comment
  • Translation
  • Original


Manga editor change! Thank you for the three years of work, Iwasaki-san! Thank you for your help going forward, Anayama-san!


原作担当交代！岩崎さん3年間ありがとうお疲れ様！穴山さんよろしく頼む！

—Eiichiro Oda
English translation by Awaikage. For comprehensive translation credits, see here.

'''Chapter 1075''' is titled "Labophase Death Game".

==Cover Page==
[[Germa 66's Ahh... An Emotionless Excursion]], Vol. 31: "The Genius Scientist gets an audience with the Five Elders"

[[Vegapunk]] meets the [[Five Elders]].

==Short Summary==
As the groups are still looking for [[Vegapunk]], [[Vegapunk/Shaka|Shaka]] notices someone is taking out the [[Den Den Mushi|surveillance]] so they could not find Vegapunk easily. [[Usopp]]'s group finds a badly damaged [[Vegapunk/Pythagoras|Pythagoras]] who had to disconnect its head from the body who while surprised warns the group as [[S-Snake]] appears and [[Mero Mero no Mi|petrifies]] [[Vegapunk/York|York]] and then attacks them. As [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]]'s group is attacked by [[S-Bear]] and [[S-Hawk]], Shaka realizes someone had gained control of the [[Seraphim]] and is trying to kill them all. Realizing they are also in danger a reawakened [[Rob Lucci|Lucci]] and [[Kaku]] suggest a temporary alliance, much to the chagrin of Luffy and [[Roronoa Zoro|Zoro]].

==Long Summary==
[[Vegapunk/Shaka|Shaka]] tries to reach [[Vegapunk/Pythagoras|Pythagoras]] following the explosion he heard, but he receives no response. He sends a [[Den Den Mushi|Cameko]] to search the tower, but someone takes it out, cutting off the security image. [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] realizes that the communication device he is wearing does not operate any longer, as if all communications have been cut off. Luffy tells Shaka as he tries to contact the other Satellites, but one-by-one, all of the Cameko go off, making him think that someone else is in the Labophase causing trouble.

Throughout the Labophase, everyone is searching for [[Vegapunk|Dr. Vegapunk]]. In Tower A Floor 3, [[Nami]] and [[Brook]] are traveling with [[Vegapunk/Edison|Edison]]. Nami gets sidetracked by diamonds she finds and wants to keep despite Edison telling her that their priority is finding the Stella. When he tells her that they were manmade, Nami is left in awe over such achievements. On Floor 2, [[Tony Tony Chopper|Chopper]] and [[Nico Robin|Robin]] are with [[Vegapunk/Atlas|Atlas]], who reveals that her face is a mask and she can replace whatever part of her gets damaged. Robin then notices something which Atlas reveals is an artificial organ, which amazes Chopper, though Robin notes she thought Vegapunk had gotten chopped up, much to Atlas’ discomfort.

In the B Tower, [[Sanji]] and [[Jinbe]] have gone with [[Stussy]], with Sanji swooning over her and asking if she would call him a dog, while she flirtatiously reminds him to find Vegapunk. Jinbe acknowledges how huge the part of the lab they are in is as Stussy reveals that they are on the weapon’s manufacturing floor, so they can’t be setting off any shockwaves. As for the last group, which consists of [[Usopp]], [[Franky]], [[Vegapunk/Lilith|Lilith]], and [[Vegapunk/York|York]], the four head to Tower C. They end up finding Pythagoras’ body, albeit with his head missing. Thankfully, Pythagoras turned out to be fine, as he had detached his head from his body before he sustained damage. Lilith tries to reach Shaka but fails to do so, and when Franky suggests they fight back, Lilith tells him it is impossible to beat a [[Seraphim]].

Back in Tower A, Luffy and Shaka meet up with [[Roronoa Zoro|Zoro]] as they see that [[S-Bear]] and [[S-Hawk]] have breached the room. Despite Shaka’s attempts to make them stop, the two Seraphim open fire. Thankfully, they evade their attacks while also saving the unconscious [[Rob Lucci|Lucci]] and [[Kaku]], who were in the Seraphim’s sights. Shaka begins to fear that Vegapunk himself is commanding the Seraphim if the Satellites cannot get them to stop. He also realizes that someone is trying to kill everyone by trapping them and cutting off communications, and that they set up this situation very carefully. Lucci and Kaku then wake up and ask Luffy and Zoro to set the two of them free, offering that they form a truce and work together to survive. Luffy and Zoro respond with a look of disgust.
